name: OpenClaw Manager
tagline: Programmatically provision new OpenClaw agents on DigitalOcean
description: Designed for an AI manager agent (or human with CLI access) running on a Linux machine. Given a YAML config file with the agent's name, region, and channels, the script creates a DigitalOcean droplet, installs OpenClaw, configures Telegram/Gmail, and stores all secrets in 1Password. The manager must have doctl, op (1Password CLI), and SSH access set up before running.

credits.name: OpenClaw
credits.description: Builds on the openclaw-droplet rig by marshellis. This rig automates the provisioning process for programmatic use by manager agents.

whatItDoes: Given an agent configuration file, this rig creates a new DigitalOcean droplet, installs OpenClaw, configures channels (Telegram, Gmail), and stores all secrets in 1Password. The manager reads shared secrets (like Anthropic API keys) from 1Password and creates agent-specific entries prefixed with the agent name. After provisioning, the new agent is running and reachable via its configured channels.
useCases: Spin up a new AI team member with one command
Manage a fleet of OpenClaw agents across projects
Reproducible agent provisioning with secrets in 1Password

prerequisites.name: Linux machine with SSH
prerequisites.description: The manager runs from an existing Linux box (e.g., another OpenClaw instance or any server). Must have SSH client installed.

prerequisites.name: DigitalOcean API token (via doctl)
prerequisites.description: Create a token at cloud.digitalocean.com/account/api/tokens with Droplet (all) and SSH Key (read) scopes. Then run: doctl auth init --access-token <token>. Verify with: doctl compute ssh-key list

prerequisites.name: SSH key registered in DigitalOcean
prerequisites.description: At least one SSH key must be added to your DigitalOcean account. The script injects this key into new droplets for access. Check with: doctl compute ssh-key list. Add one with: doctl compute ssh-key create my-key --public-key-file ~/.ssh/id_ed25519.pub

prerequisites.name: 1Password service account (via op CLI)
prerequisites.description: Create a service account at 1password.com (Developer > Service Accounts) with access to your secrets vault (default: 'AI-Agents'). Set the token: export OP_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_TOKEN=<token>. Verify with: op vault list

prerequisites.name: Anthropic API key in 1Password
prerequisites.description: Store an Anthropic API key in your 1Password vault. The script auto-finds items with 'anthropic' in the title, or you can specify the exact item name in the agent config. Get a key at console.anthropic.com.

prerequisites.name: Telegram bot token (if using Telegram)
prerequisites.description: Create a bot BEFORE running the script: open Telegram, message @BotFather, send /newbot, pick a name and username. Copy the token -- the script will prompt you to paste it during setup.

installerActions.label: Install manager tools
installerActions.detail: Installs doctl, op, jq, and yq if not already present. Verifies authentication for doctl and op.

installerActions.label: Download rig files
installerActions.detail: Downloads create-agent.sh, preflight.sh, and templates to ~/.openclaw-manager/rig/

verificationSteps.instruction: Run preflight.sh to verify all prerequisites
verificationSteps.expectedResult: All checks pass: doctl authenticated, op authenticated, SSH keys found, Anthropic key in vault, 0 failures.

verificationSteps.instruction: Run preflight.sh with an agent config file
verificationSteps.expectedResult: Config validates: name set, vault accessible, channel config valid.
Droplet created, OpenClaw installed, agent responds to test prompt.
